intro: Crotalaria pseudoeriosema, commonly known as the narrow-leaved false cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine. The plant's ability to fix nitrogen makes it beneficial for soil enrichment in agricultural settings.
